complaint_what_happened:
On XX/XX/XXXX I submitted a stop payment request for a charge in the amount of {$190.00} ; I was charged a {$31.00} fee for this. A few days went by and I was not made aware of the status of the stop payment order so I reached out to the bank on XXXX to get more information. I was told that since the transaction posted before I placed the stop payment order on my account a claim was filed instead.From my understanding of the process a temporary credit would be placed on the account for the transaction amount and there is also not a fee for this service. I requested to have the {$31.00} credited back to my account ; the representatives I spoke with were unwilling to do this. The reason why the claim was filed is because the charges were unexpected and it would cause a financial hardship for me because I also had a very important payment that would be coming out of my account soon. 

On XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX attempted to debit my mortgage payment from my account in the amount of {$1900.00}. At the time I had {$1900.00} in my account ; I was under the impression that a temporary credit in the amount of {$190.00} would be applied to my account for the claim that was in process. I deposited the cash I had on hand on XX/XX/XXXX and expected that my mortgage payment would be cleared. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I got up on Saturday morning to discover that my mortgage payment had been returned. I looked further into this and from my perspective if the {$31.00} fee had been waived for the stop payment and also the temporary credit placed on my account for {$190.00} my account would have had sufficient funds to cover the transaction. The bank also changed the order of transactions that came into my account ; there was an additional charge of {$38.00} from my credit card company that they allowed to post and sent the payment back to XXXX XXXX. I know for sure that XXXX XXXX debited the money from my account first ; if any payment was returned it should have been the {$38.00} payment, and once again if the {$31.00} stop payment fee had been credited back to my account in this situation I would have had enough funds in my account to cover the payment from XXXX XXXX.If I would have known that I was not going to have a temporary credit on my account right away I would have deposited more money which is what I did on Saturday morning when I realized the payment had been returned. 

My main issue is that the bank sent back a payment that should have been covered in which now my credit is at risk. I sent in a request on XX/XX/XXXX requesting that they immediately reconcile this situation by contacting XXXX XXXX to cover the payment. As a 15 year customer I expected better treatment from WellsFargo than what I received. They have been in a position to capitalize off of me for years, I have paid thousands in fees over the years that I have had my account and I have always managed to keep my account open and active no matter how bad things got for me financially. However, in this situation I was not experiencing a hardship at all, I had more than enough money to cover the payment. Due to a miscommunication about the process I walked away with a different understanding. I don't think I should have to suffer because of this.

complaint_what_happened: This is reference to an already open complaint filed with the CFPB ( XXXX ). I really need the CFPB to understand the egregious incompetence of the The Wells Fargo Home Equity Organization. I appreciate the diligence the CFPB has exhibited to date regarding my initial complaint, but the reasons WF is seeking extensions to what should be a relatively straight admission of gross misconduct/neglect is appalling. I am now providing you, yet another example of not only ineptness, but serious violations of all federally mandated privacy laws. Last Friday, I received the attached letter in response to the initial complaint. The letter is addressed to me with my current address, but opens with someone else 's name ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ). I can only assume I now know that a XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX applied for a HELOC and was denied. I only hope my name is not floating around in the world with someone else 's address. My only recourse at this point is to seek justice via litigation, but I will be extremely disappointed if strenuous enforcement action is not taken against Wells Fargo up to and including settlement agreement for my loss of a potential real estate transaction for unreasonable denial of a HELOC. For the record, I DO NOT WANT A HELOC FROM WELLS FARGO. I want recovery in the way of punitive damages. In addition disciplinary sanctions should be levied to the Wells Fargo employees connected with this process to include the letter received from XXXX XXXX ( Executive Resolution Specialist Customer Care and Recovery Group ) andXXXX XXXX at XXXX - Originator of the Loan Application for Wells Fargo.
